All Classes All Packages

C

checkConflict(Activity) - Method in class edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Activity
Checks if two Activity objects are in conflict which means they have at least one day with an overlapping time, which means that an Activity on the same day starts at the same time when another Activity ends or if an Activity begins while another Activity is still in session
checkConflict(Activity) - Method in interface edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Conflict
Declares (contract) a checkConflict method within this interface that when implemented in other classes will be used to check for conflicting Courses and Events within a student's schedule, the parameter will included an Activity which will need to be recognized as a Course and Event then checked among other Courses and Events in a student's schedule, then in the case the Activity is conflicting with another Course or Event a custom ConflictException will be thrown indicating that the student cannot add the Course or Event passed in parameter to their schedule
Conflict - Interface in edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course
The Conflict interface is used to declare a method known as checkConflict (void method) which will be used in implementing classes to determine whether a passed Activity (Course or Event) conflicts with another Course or Event in a student's schedule, in which case, a custom ConflictException will be thrown
ConflictException - Exception in edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course
This java class is used to throw a custom exception known as a ConflictException it achieves this by first extending the Exception class and using code to create the messages and conditions for when the ConflictException is thrown and then returned to the class that throws a ConflictException
ConflictException() - Constructor for exception edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.ConflictException
This constructor passes the default message to first constructor and sets the default message as "Schedule conflict." when this constructor is called (Default Message = "Schedule conflict.")
ConflictException(String) - Constructor for exception edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.ConflictException
This constructor is responsible for passing custom Exception message to parent constructor, which would be the super class known as the Exception class which this class is currently extending
Course - Class in edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course
The Course class is being utilized in the WolfScheduler program to be able to construct fields and receive all required information to create a valid Course which can include a Course's name, title, section number, credits, instructor id, meeting days, and starting and ending times if a Course's meeting times are not arranged.
Course(String, String, String, int, String, String) - Constructor for class edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Course
Second Course Constructor of the Course class which will be utilized to generate a Course object when meeting times for a Course are arranged and there are no starting or ending times
Course(String, String, String, int, String, String, int, int) - Constructor for class edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.course.Course
First Course Constructor of Course class which is utilized to create a Course object with all information including a Course's name, title, section number, credits, instructor id, meeting days, starting time, and ending time
CourseRecordIO - Class in edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.io
Reads Course records from text files.
CourseRecordIO() - Constructor for class edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.io.CourseRecordIO
